sourceOrganization.name: NIAID IeDEA Consortium
sourceOrganization.description: The IeDEA Cohort Consortium collaborates to collect and define key variables, harmonize data, and implement methodology to effectively pool data as a cost-effective means of generating large data sets. IeDEA collects HIV/AIDS data from seven international regional data centers, including four in Africa, and one each in the Asia-Pacific region, the Central/South America/Caribbean region, and North America. For more information, visit the NIAID program page: https://www.niaid.nih.gov/research/iedea-cohort-consortium
alternateName: International Epidemiology Databases to Evaluate AIDS Cohort Consortium
